text: LY-272,015 is a beta-carboline derivative drug developed by Eli Lilly, which acts as a potent and selective antagonist at the serotonin 5-HT2B receptor. It has anti-hypertensive effects in animal models, and is also used in research into the other functions of the 5-HT2B receptor. == References == Category:5-HT2B antagonists Category:Beta-Carbolines Category:Eli Lilly and Company brands Category:Phenol ethers
title: LY-272,015
